intro: Limonium gougetianum subsp. balearicum, commonly known as the Balearic sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Balearic Islands. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in coastal or sandy habitats. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is well adapted to salty and windy environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
